page.title: 18Toddington Steam Railway
page.content: {Cheltenham and Stratford Railway Ltd. is a company run by steam railway enthusiasts. Their long term project is to re-open sections of the former Great Western Railway main line between Cheltenham and Stratford which was closed in 1968.The Society arrived at the site of{Toddington Station in 1981. All the track had been removed and the station was derelict. Since then the Society have laid 1.5 miles of track. The station is in the process of restoration together with numerous steam and diesel locomotives. The station is open to the public on Sundays and Bank Holidays between Easter and September. They operate standard and narrow gauge rides. They have about 1000 visitors a month. They hope to extend their operations in the future, firstly to{Winchcombe}and ultimately to{Cheltenham}.
